longDescription: Santiago de Compostela, meaning "Saint James of the Field of Stars," has been one of the three most important Christian pilgrimage destinations since the medieval period, alongside Jerusalem and Rome. The city claims to hold the remains of Saint James the Greater, one of Jesus's twelve apostles and the first to be martyred. Saint James martyred in Jerusalem by Herod Agrippa

primaryLocation.name: The Way of Saint James - Medieval Europe's Greatest Pilgrimage

searchTerms: the way of saint james - medieval europe's greatest pilgrimage

name: Santiago de Compostela
